meanings.definition: A mathematical structure consisting of a set of elements with a binary operation that is associative and has an identity element.
meanings.sent1: In mathematics, groupoids are sets with a special way of combining elements.
meanings.sent2: The groupoids in algebra help us understand how elements interact with each other.
meanings.sent3: The groupoids at the math party were always associating and finding their identity.
meanings.sent4: The groupoids in the equation danced together, showing their associative moves.
meanings.sent5: Visualizing groupoids as a group of friends playing together makes the concept easier to grasp.

meanings.definition: A collection of related items or individuals.
meanings.sent1: The groupoids of students gathered for a study session.
meanings.sent2: She organized the groupoids of books on the shelf by genre.
meanings.sent3: The groupoids of colorful socks in the drawer seemed to have a party every night.
meanings.sent4: The groupoids of stars in the sky twinkled like a celestial gathering.
meanings.sent5: The groupoids of flowers in the garden created a beautiful mosaic of colors.
